hello.h5: I am a first-year Computer Engineering student at University of Waterloo, interested in programming languages.
hello.p: This is the landing website that links all my public information.

projects.title: Personal Website
projects.text: This is a responsive personal website function as my portfolio and linktree, which is also my first real website. Special thanks to AutonotionR project, which I used as guideline.

projects.title: Felys Interpreter
projects.text: Felys is a simple interpreted programming language which support variable, calculation, loops, conditions. There is a finished OOP design as well, but yet to merge to Felys.

projects.title: Chemistry Calculator
projects.text: Chemistry calculator can do most of high-school-level chemistry problems. You can use it in a website made by my friend, import it as a python package, or execute it in terminal.

more.title: General information
more.text: My preferred name is Jonny Jin, and you might know me as FelysNeko or Jhanny Kin on the Internet.

more.title: Why the name FelysNeko
more.text: The term Felys is the combination of two names: Pardofelis and Elysia (from Honkai Impact 3rd), and Neko means cat.

more.title: Images used in this website
more.text: These are the Firemoth logos (from Honkai Impact 3rd). The golden version is the 25th-anniversary commemorative badge. However, Firemoth did not last that long, and the world came to an end, so the golden version is never revealed to the public. Hence, I used it as the default image for project cards because both of them do not exist.

more.title: Everything about my tech stack
more.text: I started with Python a few years ago and am proficient in Python (OOP development, webcrawler, data analysis, image processing, machine learning, backend, etc). In order to gain a deeper understanding in Python, I learned C and became really interested in building programming languages. I also taught myself CentOS for server maintenance and Kali Linux for hacking knowledge. (RHEL and GNU/Linux are pretty different, so it took me a long time to get comfortable with both of them). Then, I came to the university and quickly realized that my tech stack was too wired and incomplete to find a co-op. Therefore, I started to learn C++ (ECE150) and web development skills like React.js and Typescript.

more.title: Personal hobbies and interests
more.text: As for outdoor activities, I play frisbee and baseball, though I haven't played them for a long time due to heavy workload. Other than that, I spend most of time watching anime, playing guitar (anime song only), and coding.
